199134-d-11-15-06-DH.Narrative: DA13 PULLING 4 LOADS FROM THE SIDING.  THE WHEEL PASSED OVER THE JOINT JUST IN FRONT OF THE SPLIT RAIL DERAIL. THE LOAD OF THE CAR ALLOWED THE HIGH RAIL OF THE SWITCH TO LEAN WHILE THE OTHER TRUCK OFCARS MOVED OVER THE HEEL OF THE SWITCH POINT. THE HEEL OF THE POINT HAS A 3/4 INCH GAP BETWEEN THE RAIL AND TIE. THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO CONDITIONS ALLOWED THE POINT TO LIFT AND GAP SO THE WHEELCOULD GET BEHIND THE POINT RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT.

199242-d-11-21-06-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 528-21 DOUBLED UP AT NS OAKWOOD YARD AND PULLED UP TO DEPART AT APPROXIMATELY 1845. ACCOUNT PROBLEMS AT DELRAY TRAIN WAS ASKED TO BACK UP AND PLACE INTO CLEAR AT OAKWOOD YARD. CREW WAS RELIEVEDOF THE REQUIREMENT TO PROTECT THEIR TAIL-END BY THE NS YARDMASTER. NS YARDMASTER HAD HIS YARD JOB TAKE THE ROOM BACKWARDS. TRAIN WAS REVERSED AND PLACED IN THE CLEAR AND TIED DOWN. RECREW WAS PLACED ON THE TRAIN AT APPROXIMATELY 2300HRS AND WERE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONS TO DEPART. TRAIN STARTED TO DEPARTAND SHORTLY THEREAFTER WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CREW WENT BACK AND INSPECTED TRAIN AND FOUND 4 CARS DERAILED. AFTER INVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT NS OPERATION'S TEAM FOUND NO FAILURE ON THE PART OF CP CREWS. THEY EXONERATED BOTH CP CREWS OF ANY WRONG DOING OR RULES INFRACTIONS ON THE OPERATING END. WHENCREW REVERSED TRAIN INTO THE CLEAR AND WERE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONS TO BACK UP THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES WERE NOT PROPERLY LINED BY THE NS YARD JOB RESULTING IN THE CROSSOVERS BEING RUN THROUGH. HUMAN FACTORNS RESPONSIBILITY. THIS WAS A FACING POINT MOVE. WHEN THE RECREW PULLED TO DEPART THEY HAD NO REASON TO BELIEVE THAT ANYTHING WAS WRONG AND DERAILED AT THE LONG #1/#2 CROSS-OVER. REQUEST WAS MADE TONS ON 11/29/06 ASKING FOR INCIDENT NUMBER, TRACK COSTS AND EQUIPMENT REPAIRS.  RECEIVED THIER INCIDENT NUMBER ON 12/11/06. TRACK COSTS OF $4,000.00 ON 12/27/06 AND AFTER REPEATED REQUEST ON 12/27 RECEIVED EQUIPMENT COSTS AS NS HAD DONE THE EQUIPMENT REPAIRS FOR CP.

THE RCO ENGINEEROF LOCOMOTIVE 459 ATTEMPTED UNSUCCESSFULLY TO MOVE LOCOMOTIVE 459 BACK TO OLD COKE PLANT #7 TRACK TOBE CLEAR OF SWITCH #38.  LOCOMOTIVE 68 THEN COLLIDED WITH LOCOMOTIVE 459 THAT WAS FOUL OF THE SWITCH 38.

199033-d-11-09-06-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT G39-08 WAS INSTRUCTED BY THE UP PROVISO TOWER YARDMASTER TO MAKE A CUT WHERE THEY WERE ONTRACK 15 AND SHOVE THE CARS BACK IN THE CLEAR ON TRACK 11. CREW HAD AHOLD OF 40 CARS TO PUT INTO TRACK 11 YARD 4. 38 CARS WENT IN, THEN CARS 39 AND 40 DERAILED AT THE SWITCH. STUDENT ENGINEER WAS INCONTROL WHILE THE CONDUCTOR RODE THE POINT. CONDUCTOR GAVE A CAR COUNT OF 10, AND SOON AFTER THE ENGINEER INSTRUCTOR NOTICED CAR #39 ABOUT TO TIP OVER AND SHOUTED "THAT'LL DO, THAT'LL DO" AT WHICH TIME THE STUDENT ENGINEER PUT THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE VALVE INTO EMERGENCY AND THE INSTRUCTING ENGINEER WATCHED CAR #39 TIP OVER AND OBSERVED CAR #40 WAS ON THE GROUND.  SOO FIELD OPS MANAGERS, ALONG WITH THE UP ROAD FOREMAN REVIEWED THE LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOADS AT THE SCENE AND SEVERAL TIMES THEREAFTER, AND BOTH SOO & UP AGREED THAT TRAIN HANDLING WAS WELL WITHIN STANDARDS. CREW WAS SHOVING AT 4.1 MPH (AS INDICATED FROM LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOAD), 100-200 AMPS, 1&2 NOTCH. NO AUTOMATIC AIR WAS USED. SOO ENGINEERING INSPECTION INDICATES LEAD TRUCK-2ND WHEEL NORTH SIDE ON THE TTGX 961932 HAD PICKED THE SWITCH. OBSERVED MISSING GAGE PLATES AT THE SWITCH. THERE WERE SPIKES ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PLATES THAT APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN PUT THERE TO KEEP CORRECT GAGE. ALSO VISIBLE THAT THE PLATES ON THE SOUTH SIDE HADBEEN PUSHED OUT, DIGGING INTO THE TIES, WHICH IS A SIGN OF WIDE GAGE. UP ADVISES TRACK REPAIRS $3,970.00. UP NOT IN AGREEMENT THAT CAUSE RELATED TO TRACK STRUCTURE. SEE HARD COPY ATTACHMENT OF SOO LIN

111306-d-11-13-06-SLRS.Primary Accident Cause: Highway user impairment because of drug or alcohol usage  (as determined by local authorities, e.g.,
111306-d-11-13-06-SLRS.Accident Cause: Highway user impairment because of drug or alcohol usage  (as determined by local authorities, e.g.,
111306-d-11-13-06-SLRS.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW WAS SHOVING THE CONSIST ACROSS A GRADE CROSSING.  THE ONE BRAKEMAN HAD ACTIVATED A MANUALLY OPERATED SWITCH THAT CONTROLS A HIGHWAY TRAFFIC LIGHT TO PROTECT THE CROSSING.  THE CONDUCTORAND OTHER BRAKEMAN WERE RIDING THE HEAD END.  A MOTOR VEHICLE MADE A LEFT TURN FROM A CROSS STREETINTO THE PATH OF THE TRAIN.  THE TRAIN PUSHED THE MOTOR VEHICLE ACROSS A SWITCH OPENING UP THE POINTS AND DERAILING THE LEAD RAIL CAR.  THE MOTOR VEHICLE WAS CRUSHED BETWEEN THE MOVING TRAIN AND OTHERSTANDING RAIL CARS RESULTING IN THE DRIVER'S FATALITY.  DRUG OR ALCOHOL IMPAIRMENT IS NOT LISTED ASA ROOT CAUSE AS THE EMPLOYEE WHO TESTED POSITIVE WAS ACTING AS A SECOND BRAKEMAN AT THE TIME OF THEINCIDENT.  HE WAS RIDING THE LEADING END OF THE SHOVING MOVE, HOWEVER, THE CONDUCTOR, WHO WAS RIDING THE HEAD END ALSO, ACTUALLY WAS CONTROLLING THE MOVE.  THE OTHER BRAKEMAN AT THE TIME WAS ON THE GROUND PROTECTING THE CROSSING.  THE ENGINEER, CONDUCTOR AND THE ON GROUND BRAKEMAN DID NOT TEST POSITIVE.  THERE WAS NO INDICATION THAT THE EMPLOYEE WHO TESTED POSITIVE HAD IMPAIRED JUDGMENT, OR HAD ANY BEARING ON THE ACCIDENT.

GWRCS06026-d-11-07-06-GWR.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
GWRCS06026-d-11-07-06-GWR.Narrative: THE GW 02 JOB WAS ENROUTE FROM FT. COLLINS, CO TO WINDSOR, CO WITH FIFTEEN LOADS AND EIGHT EMPTY CARS.  AT 1440, THE CREW REPORTED THAT THEY HAD DERAILED AT THE COUNTY ROAD FIFTEEN CROSSING.  UPON INSPECTION, FIVE CARS WERE FOUND TO HAVE DERAILED, EIGHT CARS BEHIND THE ENGINES.  TWO OF THE CARS WEREBURIED BADLY ENOUGH THAT HULCHER EMERGENCY SERVICES WERE CALLED.  THE ROAD CROSSING WAS BLOCKED FORABOUT ONE HOUR; THE WHEEL TRUCK WAS USED TO PULL THE REMAINING PORTION OF THE TRAIN BACK TO THE WEST CLEAR UP THE ROAD CROSSING.  THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS FOUND TO BE POOR CROSSTIE CONDITIONS.UELX 7819 9 WAS THE FIRST CAR TO GO ON THE GROUND INSIDE THE RAILS.  THE FOLLOWING CARS CONTINUEDUNTIL THE TIES AND ROADBED GAVE OUT. THE  CREW REPORTED THAT THEY WERE TRAVELING LESS THAN 10 MILESPER HOUR.  THE ENGINEER REALIZED THEY HAD DERAILED, AND CAME TO A STOP BEFORE LOSING AIR.  THE CARSWERE ON THE GROUND LESS THAN TWO HUNDRED FEET, SO ROLLER BEARING INSPECTIONS ONLY WILL BE REQUIRED.THERE WAS SOME OUTLET GATE DAMAGE AND SOME BRAKE RIGGING DAMAGE.  WOULD ESTIMATE CAR DAMAGE AT $6,000.  THE CARS WILL GO TO DESTINATION (O I) TO UNLOAD AND THEN COME TO THE RIP TRACK IN LOVELAND FORREPAIRS.  IT TOOK HULCHER'S MOST OF THE DAY TO RERAIL THE CARS.  WOULD ESTIMATE THEIR BILL AT $25,000.  CONTRACTORS ON SITE REPARING THE TRACK DAMAGE.  NEED TO REPLACE ROUGHLY 150 TIES AND SIX STICKSOF RAIL.  TRACK DAMAGE ESTIMATE IS  $10,000.  SHOULD HAVE THE TRACK OPEN FOR LIMITED USE BY DAYS END

1319018-d-11-01-06-CLC.Accident Cause: Improper placement of cars in train between terminals
1319018-d-11-01-06-CLC.Narrative: THE CONDUCTOR WAS SIMULTANEOUSLY WALKING DOWN TO LINE THE SWITCH FOR THE LONG PASS AT MILCO.  AFTERTHE SWITCH WAS LINED, THE BRAKEMAN INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO "GIVE ME A PIN," TO SEPARATE THE CABOOSE FROM THE TRAIN SO THAT THE CABOOSE COULD ROLL INTO THE LONG PASS TRACK.  THE TRAIN TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 1 TO 1 1/2 CAR LENGTHS AND THEN WENT INTO EMERGENCY (DYNAMITED).   THERE WAS COMMUNICATIONBETWEEN THE CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER AS TO WHAT MIGHT HAVE CAUSED THE EMERGENCY PROCEDURE.  THE ENGINEER THEN BEGAN TO TROUBLESHOOT AND TRY TO GAIN HIS AIR BACK IN THE TRAIN LINE SYSTEM.  HE NOTICED THEAIR GAUGE DROPPING SLIGHTLY.  THE CONDUCTOR BEGAN WALKING THE TRAIN TO SEE IF THERE WAS AN AIR HOSEUNCOUPLED.  HE WALKED APPROXIMATELY 25 CARS BEFORE DISCOVERING THE SITE OF THE DERAILMENT.  THE CONDUCTOR INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO CONTACT THE OPERATIONS MANAGER AS TO THE DERAILMENT AT THE WEST END OF BRIDGE 7.  THE CARS INCLUDED IN THE DERAILMENT, IN THE FOLLOWING ORDER FROM EAST TO WEST, WERE:BNSF 562736; BNSF 561461; ATW 84035; TTZX 866145; TBOX 665239; FCEN 96519; TBOX 665344.  THE CARSWERE EMPTY, SO THERE WAS NO LADING LOSS.  ALSO, THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE, AND ONLY MINOR COSMETIC DAMAGE TO THE BRIDGE STRUCTURE.  THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE CLEAN UP AND RE-RAILING OPERATION, THERE WERENO NEAR MISSES, NO FIRST AIDS; NO INJURIES OF ANY KIND.  THERE WERE NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS INVOLVEDIN THE DERAILMENT.
